metadata.Title: CVE-2013-0220 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The (1) sss_autofs_cmd_getautomntent and (2) sss_autofs_cmd_getautomntbyname function in responder/autofs/autofssrv_cmd.c and the (3) ssh_cmd_parse_request function in responder/ssh/sshsrv_cmd.c in System Security Services Daemon (SSSD) before 1.9.4 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read, crash, and restart) via a crafted SSSD packet.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-0220` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libipa-hbac0 - 1.9.3-0ubuntu2
libnss-sss - 1.9.3-0ubuntu2
libpam-sss - 1.9.3-0ubuntu2
libsss-idmap0 - 1.9.3-0ubuntu2
libsss-nss-idmap0 - 1.9.3-0ubuntu2
libsss-simpleifp0 - 1.9.3-0ubuntu2
libsss-sudo - 1.9.3-0ubuntu2
libwbclient-sssd - 1.9.3-0ubuntu2
python-libipa-hbac - 1.9.3-0ubuntu2
python-libsss-nss-idmap - 1.9.3-0ubuntu2
python-sss - 1.9.3-0ubuntu2
python3-libipa-hbac - 1.9.3-0ubuntu2
python3-libsss-nss-idmap - 1.9.3-0ubuntu2
python3-sss - 1.9.3-0ubuntu2
sssd - 1.9.3-0ubuntu2
sssd-ad - 1.9.3-0ubuntu2
sssd-ad-common - 1.9.3-0ubuntu2
sssd-common - 1.9.3-0ubuntu2
sssd-dbus - 1.9.3-0ubuntu2
sssd-ipa - 1.9.3-0ubuntu2
sssd-krb5 - 1.9.3-0ubuntu2
sssd-krb5-common - 1.9.3-0ubuntu2
sssd-ldap - 1.9.3-0ubuntu2
sssd-proxy - 1.9.3-0ubuntu2
sssd-tools - 1.9.3-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sssd package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.3-0ubuntu2').
